page.title: 20SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: {Knightswood}is a{council}run{home}for the{elderly}situated in pleasant country surroundings.It can cater for{ {36 people}- 33 residential and 3 for day care.There are 25 part time staff and officers but no nurses.There is a television room and a library.The W.R.V.S. provide a Trolley Shop and a Luncheon Club once a week. There are classes for music and movement and handicraft. There are film shows and bingo. Each Sunday a religious service is held.{ } {Grade Three Sheltered Housing}- There are{22 flats}and{14 semi-detached {bungalows}situated in three areas of the village. The warden, who keeps a daily diary, arranges home helps, meals on wheels, visits by the doctor and social workers and supplies kitchen and bathroom aids.
